meanings.definition: The father of one's father or mother.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather tells me stories about when he was young.
meanings.sent2: I visited my grandfather's house on the weekend.
meanings.sent3: My grandfather always falls asleep in his favorite chair.
meanings.sent4: The old clock on the wall ticked like my grandfather's heart.
meanings.sent5: The smell of pipe tobacco always reminds me of my grandfather.

meanings.definition: To be a grandfather to someone.
meanings.sent1: I hope to grandfather my grandchildren with love and wisdom.
meanings.sent2: He will grandfather his son's children with kindness and guidance.
meanings.sent3: She likes to joke that she will grandfather her future grandkids with ice cream for breakfast.
meanings.sent4: His patience and understanding grandfathered many young people in the community.
meanings.sent5: The old man's stories grandfathered the children into a world of imagination.

meanings.definition: A title of respect for an elderly man.
meanings.sent1: The villagers affectionately called him Grandfather John.
meanings.sent2: In many cultures, the title of grandfather is a symbol of wisdom and experience.
meanings.sent3: Grandfather always has a twinkle in his eye when he tells jokes.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree in the park stood tall like a grandfather watching over the children playing.
meanings.sent5: The grandfather of the village was known for his kind heart and gentle nature.
